zone.line: Wagner
How can you yourself therefore trouble!
Does not to a brave man enough;
The art, which thesey him decieve
Scientifically & punctually to practise
If As
When thou as a young man thy father honourest
So will thou willingly from him recieved
As
If thou, as man, knowledge encreasest
So can thy son to a higher limit arrive
Faust.
O happy, who still hope can
In this sea of errors plunged.
What one not knows that ever uses one,
And what one knows can one not use
Yet let us this hour very good
Thro such sorrows not sequestrate!
Consider how in the Evening Sun's gleam
The huts glimmer
It removes & grows weak, the day is overlived
hastens
There moves it here & demands new life
